name: sugarcane loading, by loader | sugarcane loading, by loader | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20970/documentation

This dataset represents the manually harvested sugarcane loading operation in one hectare (ha). This operation only occurs when the sugarcane is manually harvested. Functional unit (FU) is one hectare of sugarcane loading. The operation time is about 3.88 hours per ha (75.8% of this time is effectively worked, discounting time for maintenance, waiting in the field and re-allocations between the plots).;Dataset authors:;Mateus Ferreira Chagas, CTBE, mateus.chagas@bioetanol.org.br; Otávio Cavalett, CTBE, otavio.cavalett@bioetanol.org.br; Terezinha de Fátima Cardoso, CTBE, terezinha.cardoso@bioetanol.org.br; Antonio Bonomi, CTBE, antonio.bonommi@bioetanol.org.br;References:;1. Cavalett, O., Chagas, M.F., Magalhães, P.S.G., Carvalho, J.L.N. Cardoso, T.F., Franco, HC.J., Braunbeck, O.A., Bonomi, A., 2016a. The Agricultural Produciton Model. In: Bonomi, A., Cavalett, O., Pereira da Cunha, M., Lima, M.A.P. (Eds.). Virtual Biorefinery: An Optimization Strategy for Renewable Carbon Valorization. 13-52. ;2. Nemecek T, Kagi T (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Agricultural Production Systems – Data v2.0, Zurich and Dubendorf: 2007

From manually harvested sugarcane in the agricultural field to be loaded.

This activity includes the sugarcane loading into the transport truck, and ends with sugarcane transfered to the transport trucks. The dataset includes the diesel fuel consumption (9.62 L of diesel per hour of effective operation) and the amount of agricultural machinery and shed. Also taken into consideration is the amount of emissions to the air from diesel combustion and the emission to the soil from tyre abrasion during the work process.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Most of the data used to modelling this activity were collected in the last few years (2012-2014).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The global dataset is modeled based on information from sugarcane production system in Brazilian South-Cental region.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This activity is performed with a sugarcane grab loader (power 90 hp; weight 3400 kg). Life spam of the machinery is considered as 8000 operating hours. Machinery used, fuel consumption and operation efficiencies were based on data from sugarcane mills in Brazil, expert's informations and unpublished data.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolated from Brazilian data, uncertainty adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The main source of data for agricultural inputs and operations modelling procedures is detailed in Cavalett et al., 2016. Emissions from the agricultural process are estimated according to Nemecek and Kagi, 2007.

flow.name: sugarcane loading, by loader
